snippet: A crime thriller set in mid-19-century New York, a survey of harmonious diversity in a borough and a look at a former slave’s gardening habits.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books The Gods of Gotham by Lyndsay Fay, Pax Ethnica: Where and How Diversity Succeeds by Karl E Meyer and Shareen Blair Brysac and Freedom's Gardener: James F Brown, Horticulture and the Hudson Valley in Antebellum America by Myra B Young Armstead.
lead_paragraph: A crime thriller set in mid-19-century New York, a survey of harmonious diversity in a borough and a look at a former slave’s gardening habits.

headline.seo: Accessing ‘The Gods of Gotham,’ ‘Pax Ethnica’ and ‘Freedom’s Gardener’
